body_html: Hmm, isn't the real problem that, somehow, on Arch Linux, read wasn't actually include'd into scope? So wouldn't adding a header include fix the problem. Can you check if that would work? It seems a lot more robust than manually performing implicit conversions.
body_text: Hmm, isn't the real problem that, somehow, on Arch Linux, read wasn't actually include'd into scope? So wouldn't adding a header include fix the problem. Can you check if that would work? It seems a lot more robust than manually performing implicit conversions.
body: Hmm, isn't the real problem that, somehow, on Arch Linux, `read` wasn't actually include'd into scope? So wouldn't adding a header include fix the problem. Can you check if that would work? It seems a lot more robust than manually performing implicit conversions.
